description: Markdown documentation standards
---

# Markdown Standards

## Structure

- Use ATX-style headers (`#`, `##`, etc.)
- One H1 (`#`) per document at the top
- Logical heading hierarchy - don't skip levels

## Code Blocks

- Always specify language for syntax highlighting
- Use inline code for short references: `functionName`
- Use fenced blocks for multi-line code

## Links

- Use descriptive link text, not "click here"
- Prefer relative links for internal docs
- Check links work before committing

## Tables

- Align columns for readability in source
- Keep tables simple - complex data belongs elsewhere

## Lists

- Use `-` for unordered lists
- Use `1.` for ordered lists (auto-numbering)
- Indent 2 spaces for nested lists
